prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, and 0.0, and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Now create the sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch contains one face (face\\_1). Face\\_1 has one loop (loop\\_1), which consists of four lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, and line\\_4). Here are the details of each line: * line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.5785, 0.0] * line\\_2: Start Point [0.5785, 0.0], End Point [0.5785, 0.75] * line\\_3: Start Point [0.5785, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] * line\\_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Next, scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D Sketch to generate the 3D model. The extrusion has the following properties: * extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.2163 * extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0 * sketch\\_scale: 0.75 * operation: Create a new solid body The height, width, and length of each of the intermediate parts and the final shape are as follows: * Height: 0.2163 * Width: 0.75 * Length: 0.75 The final shape of this part matches the description provided in the JSON.</description>
